New Records: Mohamed Kudus scored his 10th international goal and a brace for Ghana, including a stunning left-footed finish from the edge of the box
Key Match Events: Egypt fought back to draw 2-2 with Ghana after being 1-0 and 2-1 down, with three goals in the space of five minutes and 10 seconds
Mohamed Salah limped off with an apparent hamstring issue in the 45th minute
Iddrisu Baba headed wide of a gaping goal in stoppage time
Post-Match Reflections: Egypt lost Mohamed Salah to injury and will be hoping it is nothing too serious
Ghana will need to win their last group match against Mozambique to qualify for the quarter-finals
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Stade Felix Houphouet Boigny in Abidjan, Ivory Coast
Mohamed Kudus was awarded player of the match for his two goals
